Key Match Events: Blazers generated energy off of their defense, and a slow unraveling started to occur from there.
Portland scored 21 points off of those 14 Wolves turnovers. Minnesota scored just 12 points off of Portland’s 20.
Pre-Game Insights: Chris Finch emphasized the importance of strong perimeter defense.
The Wolves were 10-point favorites heading into Wednesday night.
Post-Match Reflections: Head Coach Chris Finch said, 'We couldn’t make a shot all night, and they threw in some timely ones.'
Finch said, 'It’s a rough patch. It’s early on.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Donte DiVincenzo missed the mark pretty handsomely on several open threes.
Rob Dillingham had a pass-first mindset out of the gate and made things happen as soon as he got into the game.
